subject: how to name the letters
msgSnippet: I ve noticed that there are two different sets of names out there for the letters of the Quikscript alphabet -- and I think members of this group use both.
messageBody:
I've noticed that there are two different sets of names out there for the letters of the Quikscript alphabet -- and I think members of this group use both. There is the set from the QS Manual, which starts out with "Pea, Bay, Tea,..." And there is the other set (I don't know where it comes from but I think I got it from the Wikipedia article about QS), which starts out "Pipe, Bob, Tut,..." I found both to have some good features. But I ended up becoming dissatisfied with both for various reasons, and now have one for my personal use, starting as "Page, Be, Tot, Do,..."

Earlier when posting here I was referring to letters by their numbers, to avoid any confusion among different systems of naming the letters. But someone mentioned it was far preferable to mention letters by their names instead. It seems that people are comfortable with both of the two main naming systems. Or am I wrong?

I'm curious if anyone can fill me in on the history of these letter-name systems, and tell me what predominates in current use.

Kind Regards to All,

Scott
